title: Analysis of U.S. Educational Technology Doctoral Programs: Curriculum Exploration via Quantitative Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level understanding of higher education and educational technology fields
context.additional_context: Learners role-play as general citizens, engaging in asynchronous online learning via personal devices (BYOD). Focuses on applying quantitative analysis methods in educational technology.

learning_goals: Learners can classify six or more major U.S. doctoral programs related to educational technology.
Learners can systematically categorize core/elective/research courses by applying quantitative content analysis methods.
Learners can design procedures for collecting curriculum data using online surveys and publicly available resources.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
